DOC.brief_summary: This prospective cohort study assess effect exposure organophosphate ( OP ) pesticides adverse reproductive outcome male female agricultural worker China . We enroll woman spouse , attempt become pregnant , observe reproductive endpoint include ( 1 ) semen parameter ( concentration , total count , motility , progression morphology ) , ( 2 ) menstrual disorder ( oligomenorrhea , amenorrhea , polymenorrhea , intermenstrual bleeding , prolong menstrual bleeding , dysmenorrhea , irregular menstruation ) ; ( 3 ) alteration hormone pattern include reduced estrogen excretion ( REE ) , anovulation , abnormal luteal phase ( ALP ) , abnormal follicular phase ( AFP ) woman abnormality LH , FSH , TSH , SHBG , inhibin-B testosterone men ; ( 4 ) fecundability ; ( 5 ) pregnancy outcomes include spontaneous abortion , preterm delivery , low birth weight , intrauterine growth retardation .
DOC.criteria: must first marriage woman husband must currently live study area ; female 's age must range 20 34 year ; couple plan leave study area live next two year . currently pregnant ; try unsuccessfully get pregnant least 1 year ; current former smoker ; plan move come year .
